channel.description: Recent content in George Bush on 0x000216

item.title: The CJEU's responses to the Iraq war and EU asylum law are uncertain.
item.description: Steve Peers Almost twelve years after it began, the Iraq war remains a point of contention, with many believing Tony Blair and George W. Bush initiated an unlawful conflict. These critics believe only a trial for war crimes for both Bush and Blair would be a satisfactory outcome. While I believe this may happen someday, it would require a jury of highly improbable individuals. (Perhaps those individuals disappeared alongside the supposed weapons of mass destruction).
